abstract: United States Marine Corps says crash of helicopter in May that killed 13 people during post-earthquake rescue mission in Nepal appears due to crew's decision to take shorter route to Kathmandu, putting them over unfamiliar terrain during disorienting weather conditions.
lead_paragraph: In its findings on the crash in May of the earthquake rescue flight, the military said the aircraft was flying over unfamiliar terrain.

headline.main: Route Decision Led to U.S. Helicopter Crash in Nepal, Marines Say
headline.print_headline: Marines Link Helicopter Crash in Nepal to Unfamiliar Route

snippet: In its findings on the crash in May of the earthquake rescue flight, the military said the aircraft was flying over unfamiliar terrain.
